intro: Pentena uniseta, commonly known as the single-set pentena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family, which includes a variety of ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single set of bracts that distinguish it from other species in the genus. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pentena uniseta is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
